sudoku.model

Class EnforcedNumberSaturator

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.model.EnforcedNumberSaturator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Saturator

    public class EnforcedNumberSaturator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Saturator
    A class holding the algorithm to solve a Sudoku by the enforced cell strategy.

    • Method Detail

      • getPossibilityCounters

        private int[] getPossibilityCounters(Structure struct,
                                     int major,
                                     Board board,
                                     int[] lastOccurence)
        Returns the possibility counters for all numbers that may be filled into the Sudoku and saves their last occurrence into lastOccurrence for the specified structure.
        Parameters:
        struct - The structure that should be analyzed.
        major - The number of the structure.
        board - The board the structure is on.
        lastOccurence - The array the last occurrences should be saved to.
        Returns:
        The possibility counters.

      • saturate

        public boolean saturate(Board board)
                 throws UnsolvableSudokuException
        Applies a solution strategy on a Sudoku, i.e., it tries to bring a Sudoku a bit nearer torwards its solution. This is done by setting cells or removing options. As invariant, if a solvable Sudoku is passed to this method, then the Sudoku is also solvable after the method's completion. During the execution the parameter board is changed.
        Specified by:
        saturate in interface Saturator
        Parameters:
        board - The Sudoku to solve.
        Returns:
        true if the board was changed, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        UnsolvableSudokuException - if the solution try resulted in an invalid Sudoku. This means that the passed Sudoku was not solvable.
